newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU Commission seeks views on trade statistics cuts.
newsitem.headline: EU Commission seeks views on trade statistics cuts.

text.p: The European Commission is seeking member states' views on cutting the number of categories used to record intra-community trade, an EU member state official said on Tuesday.
"The idea is to reduce from eight to six the so-called customs nomenclature categories under which the types of goods which cross frontiers are recorded for statistical purposes," the official said.
The issue will be raised at the sugar trade management committee on Wednesday, when member state officials will be asked to give their views on the categories used to record trade in sugar products.

"There is a considerable amount of concern on the part of some member states because reducing the categories also reduces sub-headings and much detail of internal trade records will be lost," the member state official explained.
The Commission has not yet made a proposal and is first seeking the views of member states, a Commission spokesman said.
"The idea is to cut down on the work involved in recording internal EU trade. It would not affect external trade records," the spokesman added. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
